p: In Nigeria, leaves are employed for broad-spectrum healing while the bark is exploited for management of body pains, arthritis, rheumatism, cutaneous and subcutaneous parasitic infection, malnutrition, debility, paralysis and convulsions. It is also used as fish-poisons and laxatives. The roots are used for treatment of leprosy. The fruit and seeds are used as insect repellants and arachnicides (Burkill, 1985 â–¶).
